content.content: Abstract An standard interface for defining NFT referral program from which referrers share referral code and earn a percentage of mint cost from referees who mint by using the referral code.   github.com/ethereum/EIPs         Add EIP NFT referral proposal   ethereum:master ← cdpiano:referral            opened 07:04AM - 26 Jul 22 UTC               cdpiano             +117 -0       When opening a pull request to submit a new EIP, please use the suggested templa…te: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/eip-template.md  We have a GitHub bot that automatically merges some PRs. It will merge yours immediately if certain criteria are met:   - The PR edits only existing draft PRs.  - The build passes.  - Your GitHub username or email address is listed in the 'author' header of all affected PRs, inside <triangular brackets>.  - If matching on email address, the email address is the one publicly listed on your GitHub profile.       Comments are welcomed!
content.GPT-summary: The post introduces a new Ethereum Improvement Proposal (EIP) for a standard interface to define NFT referral programs. The author invites comments and feedback on the proposal, and provides a link to the EIP template for submitting a pull request. The post does not advertise the proposal, nor does it contain entirely positive or negative feedback.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Taking off my editing hat for a bit, I have a few comments. These comments don’t necessarily need to be resolved to complete the EIP process. I think this is a very interesting idea, and is absolutely a problem that needs solving. That said, I don’t think the current proposal is specified sufficiently. It also doesn’t actually require that referrers get paid (unless I missed something.) If it isn’t enforceable on-chain, I’d argue that the information doesn’t belong on-chain.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
